qas.question: What organization gave Comcast an "F" rating in 2010?
In issuing the grade, the Corporate Library found that a third of Comcast's board was how old?
How much did Comcast pay for flights of its company jet in 2010?
What conflict did Corporate Library note with Comcast's Board?

answers.text: several of the directors either worked for the company or had business ties to it

qas.question: Who is the CEO of the Wall Street Journal?
What rating was the Corporate Library given?
How much was the cost of the NBCU acquisition?
What is the average age of Comcast's board of directors?
What company did Comcast give an F to?

context: Comcast was given an "<b5_0>F<b5_0/>" for its corporate governance practices in 2010, by <a0_0><b8_0>Corporate Library<b8_0/><a0_0/>, an independent shareholder-research organization. According to Corporate Library, Comcast's board of directors ability to oversee and control management was severely compromised (at least in 2010) by the fact that <a3_0>several of the directors either worked for the company or had business ties to it<a3_0/> (making them susceptible to management pressure), and a third of the directors were <a1_0><b7_0>over 70<b7_0/> years of age<a1_0/>. According to the Wall Street Journal nearly two-thirds of the flights of Comcast's <a2_0><b6_0>$40 million<b6_0/><a2_0/> corporate jet purchased for business travel related to the NBCU acquisition, were to CEO <b4_0>Brian Roberts<b4_0/>' private homes or to resorts.
